reviewText: This is mostly young children as opposed to "world champion dancers" as this dvd advertises. The video and audio quality is poor, and a huge amount of time is spent looking at the musicians as opposed to the dancers. Don't waste your money

The dancing on this video was excellent - I only wished the viewers could have been permitted to see more of it.  During the group dances, we only got to see a few seconds at a time, then the camera cut away to long, extended closeups of the band.  The band is important, true, but when you purchase a dance video, I think it is only fair that dancing gets to take center stage.
Comparing with the show I attened the Irish festival in Columbus OH, I would like to pay the ticket to get there than purchase this DVD

Not really what I was looking for, but good for what it is. I was hoping for more pipe music, and more examples of little girls dancing, something my young daughter could watch to get a good idea of what she might be able to learn at a Celtic dancing class. But because it wasn't really what I wanted doesn't mean its bad. It's actually quite well-produced and enjoyable on its own.
Not what I thought is would be, a bit of an amateur video. I felt as if I was watching someones home movies!
If your looking for entertainment, look elsewhere. This is more of an educational video showing some different kinds of Irish dances.

Excellent music, and real traditional dancing.  Take a look and see what dancing is all about, my favourite was the blackbirds dance, these dancers can dance rings around your so called dancers of today
I was kind of disappointed in this video.  Everyone looked sad, and the quality wasn't too high.
